intro: Iguanura leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited balsa, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, hard seeds. Its bark and wood have been traditionally used for various purposes, including construction and medicinal applications. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in disturbed habitats and its role in local ecosystems.
